newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cash soymeal - Warm weather weakens demand.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cash soymeal - Warm weather weakens demand.

text.p: Rail soymeal basis offers fell further on Monday, hit by a combination of the recent heavy crush pace and warmer weather which decreased livestock feed demands, several cash brokers said.
"There's just too much crush and it's hot out there," one southeast broker said. "The animals aren't eating as much."
Offers were down $1.00 per ton in parts of Illinois, Indiana and Ohio.
But several brokers said they expected a turnaround next week after ADM on Friday confirmed it had reduced crush rates at its U.S. plants.
There was also market talk that an Alabama processor was taking downtime.
"They're down for maintenance but I'm sure the timing of it had a lot to do with the margins and high bean costs," one broker said.
Several brokers confirmed that falling margins and increasing soybean costs were making it less attractive for processors to crush.
